org.pircbotx

Class Utils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pircbotx.Utils

  • public final class Utils
extends Object
    Useful utilities for internal PircBotX use. Users should not use this class directly
    Author:
    Leon Blakey

public static String parseCommand(String expectedPrefix,

      • parseCommand

        @Nullable
public static String parseCommand(@NonNull
                                            String expectedPrefix,
                                            @NonNull
                                            String rawCommand)
        Parse given command, if it starts with the prefix return the line minus the prefix (the arguments), otherwise return null

        • parseCommand("?say ", "?say hi everybody") == "hi everybody"
        • parseCommand("?say ", "?other stuff") == null
        • parseCommand("?start", "?start") == ""
        • parseCommand("?start", "?stop") == null
        Parameters:
        expectedPrefix - The prefix the command must start with and will be removed when returned
        rawCommand - Raw input string
        Returns:
        input string minus the prefix or null

      • addBotToMDC

      • sendRawLineToServer

        public static void sendRawLineToServer(PircBotX bot,
                                       String rawLine)
                                throws IOException
        Sends a raw line to the server. Needed so PircBotX.sendRawLineToServer(java.lang.String) can stay protected but still be callable from the org.pircbotx.output package
        Parameters:
        bot - The bot that sends the raw line
        rawLine - The raw line to send
        Throws:
        IOException

      • tokenizeLine

        public static List<String> tokenizeLine(String input)
        Tokenize IRC raw input into it's components, keeping the 'sender' and 'message' fields intact.
        Parameters:
        input - A string in the format [:]item [item] ... [:item [item] ...]
        Returns:
        List of strings.

      • unescapeV3TagValue

        public static String unescapeV3TagValue(String v3TagValue)
        Unescape IRCv3 message tag values which have been escaped before (e.g. if received from the server).
        Parameters:
        v3TagValue - Escaped IRCv3 message tag value
        Returns:
        Unescaped IRCv3 message tag value
        See Also:
        http://ircv3.net/specs/core/message-tags-3.2.html
